com.att.research.xacml.api

Interface AttributeCategory

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    RequestAttributes
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StdAttributeCategory, StdMutableAttributeCategory, StdMutableRequestAttributes, StdRequestAttributes

    public interface AttributeCategory
    Defines the API for objects representing XACML Attributes elements. Attributes elements represent collections of XACML Attribute elements with the same Category.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    Christopher A. Rath

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Implementations of the AttributeCategory interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two AttributeCategorys (a1 and a2) are equal if: a1.getCategory().equals(a2.getCategory()) AND The Attributes in a1 and a2 are pairwise equal.
      java.util.Collection<Attribute> getAttributes()
      Gets the Collection of Attributes in this AttributeCategory.
      java.util.Iterator<Attribute> getAttributes(Identifier attributeId)
      Gets an Iterator over all of the Attributes in this AttributeCategory with the given Identifier matching their XACML AttributeId.
      Identifier getCategory()
      Gets the Identifier for the XACML Category of this AttributeCategory.
      boolean hasAttributes(Identifier attributeId)
      Determines if there is at least one Attribute in this AttributeCategory whose XACML AttributeId matches the given Identifier.

    • Method Detail

      • getCategory

        Identifier getCategory()
        Gets the Identifier for the XACML Category of this AttributeCategory.
        Returns:
        the Identifier for the category of this AttributeCategory.

      • getAttributes

        java.util.Collection<Attribute> getAttributes()
        Gets the Collection of Attributes in this AttributeCategory. If there are no Attributes in this AttributeCategory then an empty Collection must be returned. The returned Collection should not be modified. Implementations are free to return an immutable view to enforce this.
        Returns:
        the Collection of Attributes in this AttributeCategory.

      • getAttributes

        java.util.Iterator<Attribute> getAttributes(Identifier attributeId)
        Gets an Iterator over all of the Attributes in this AttributeCategory with the given Identifier matching their XACML AttributeId.
        Parameters:
        attributeId - the Identifier to match against the XACML AttributeId
        Returns:
        an Iterator over all of the Attributes in this AttributeCategory with the given Identifier matching their XACML AttributeId.

      • hasAttributes

        boolean hasAttributes(Identifier attributeId)
        Determines if there is at least one Attribute in this AttributeCategory whose XACML AttributeId matches the given Identifier.
        Parameters:
        attributeId - the Identifier of the AttributeId to look for
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one Attribute whose XACML AttributeId matches the given Identifier, else false

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Implementations of the AttributeCategory interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two AttributeCategorys (a1 and a2) are equal if: a1.getCategory().equals(a2.getCategory()) AND The Attributes in a1 and a2 are pairwise equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
